reviewText: Bought the earlier seasons, but couldn't get this one on DVD, and then Amazon makes it available. This is my first "watch" using Amazon Prime, and it couldn't be easier. The shows might be just a tad under the quality of previous seasons...or I'm getting to able to predict the way these writers think, but Nessa is still pure gold, and Mike and Gwen and Dave great unsung supporting cast to the main characters of Gavin and Stacey. I'll watch another season if one turns up, for sure.
Very funny, feel good show. The characters pull you in and make you love them. I only wish that this wasn't the end and that they were able to make more shows. However they did do a tidy final.
Fantastic Show. Very Funny I live in the US but so miss british humour. Please do another season and put it on Amazon Prime.
What's accruing, that lush.  Nessa is the best, so blunt. I was wondering if they made a season 4 ?

One of the best sitcoms on TV, well, used to be on TV.  Easy to love each character, and start seeing your friends as characters in real life.  Love the show, love the humor.

Please BBC, bring it the US.
This is a very funny show. I watch all the BBC shows I can on you-tube but this one was not available. It was cheap, quick and easy to watch from amazon!

At the end of most episodes you're left wondering what's next, because they leave a situation hanging. We were so glad to have the whole series to hand, to be able to roll from one episode to the next!

Smithy has some really touching (albeit tiny) moments with his son as the series progresses and even at the grand sentimental finale of it all the writers still get laughs in, while the characters are being frank and honest.

Well written and a satisfying conclusion that will have you smiling. You just want the best for them!

great start to season 3 - had missed it on TV and it cleared up some of the mysteries.
wonder why it is not part of the UK DVD set!

Enjoyed Series 1 and 2 so much, hard to believe this, the third (and final) series, was written by the same people. It's nice to see the familiar, likeable characters;you have to feel for them, given the superficiality of the tired old lines they get to mouth, and the tedious, hackneyed situations they find themselves in.
By all means try to catch the first two series, but don't bother with this one.
Glad I could binge watch this gem but sad there were only 3 seasons.
The antics of this group of friends and family of Gavin and Stacey are comedy gold. The best series I've seen in awhile.
Delightful show: great actors, good writing, funny and sweet.  Certainly good for fans of James Corden.
This cast is great. Funny, funny show
Just great. Ended too soon and lots of funny moments and characters.

I wish they had more Seasons of this show it is one of my favorites. You can watch it over and over and still laugh while watching it even tho you've already seen it several times. A definite must see

Gavin and Stacey is our favorite series of all time.  Each character (cast member) is uniquely presented ... with dialogue that is simply perfect.  We love this show and have seen the entire series multiple times.  Highly recommended for those who enjoy a hearty laugh...
This show is awesome. I'm watching the whole thing for a second time. It makes me both laugh & cry... mostly laugh.
The only bad think about this season is that it's the last season of Gavin and Stacey!! How I wish James Cordon and Ruth Jones would bring us at least another Christmas Special!
Lush
Loved this show....hated that it only went 3 seasons.  Ruth Jones, and James Cordon are fantastic!
Wish they had done another season of this show. I love it!
One of the best shows ever! Like seriously, EVER!  An absolute must see!
One of the best tv shows I've ever watched. But with two episodes left for me to watch in Season 3 Amazon remove it from Prime? Why??
I love this show. The writing, acting, and cast are just phenomenal! I can watch it over and over. Definitely recommended it.

with all positive/5 stars review, i thought i would give it a go. boy what a let-down. just annoying show. basically coupling w/ welsh actors[ie stacey is blond like the main female character; cant have children  but spoiler alert-ending episode/season gavin & stacey  manage to have it]. plot lines just meander...

i'm sorry but i did not find it funny at all vs coupling. show is slice of life but more draggey.only interest thing was the ending ie will they get together or not. Greatful that they did.
Awesome.  But right in the middle of watching season 2 Amazon pulled the series from the Prime list and made it a paid offering.  No way, Amazon.
Excellent show, well written.  Did Amazon take it off the prime video line up?
I love this show so much. The characters are relatable. Well written. You can't help falling in love with them. I have referred it to several people.
Sharp observation, gentle humour and an endearing cast make this a fine feel-good comedy series.
Love it!  Sad it isn't prime anymore.
I really like this show very funnyI enjoy the prime time TV and the movies you have a lot of options to watch free
It only gets better!
ENCHANTING!  FUN & GIGGLES!
Just fabulous! Watched so many times and still so funny

I am addicted to the series

I normally do not do very well with British humour.  I Love stuff like Mel Brooks and old Borsch Belt comedy.  However, I have found this to be a gem.  I so wish I had gone to see James Corden at the West End live.

Knowing there are not going to be anymore episodes, I am taking my time watching series 3 :-(

This is a must watch for anyone who loves watching the human tragedy of family and love in all of is lovely flaw!
Excellent!
Im not going to lie to you. This comedy is crackin. Top notch.
This is probably my favorite season. The Christmas special is so good; I watch it over and over. Love Gavin and Stacey!

I enjoyed this season, and when it ended I watched episodes of Horne and Corden stand up comedy show on BBC and even watched episodes of 20 Things to Do Before You're Thirty, I watched them both since I wanted to see more of Mathew Horne's acting independent of Gavin and Stacey. Horne and Corden reminded me of comedy shows on Comedy Central, like Key & Peele and Inside Amy Schumer, where they both write and perform in various sketches. Anyways, I enjoyed watching Gavin and Stacey since they bring the baggage that is their family.  I just liked watching a show about typical everyday, normal people. I gave it four stars for the development of the characters across the seasons, its ability to find humor in everyday simple life, and the writing. I felt that it ended to soon, though it finished well. I also enjoyed watching Gavin (Horne) and Smithy (Corden) stand up in Horne and Corden, which resembles many comedy shows on Comedy Central. If you enjoyed Gavin & Stacey you should look into 20 Things to do Before You're Thirty which also features a character acted by Mathew Horne. I enjoy watching movies/shows on Amazon prime because of the high quality of streaming which usually isn't interrupted or sluggish. Especially, for watching shows that are a few years old like Buffy the Vampire Slayer or The XFiles. All around good show, also if your interested in my science fiction shows from BBC you should also look into Orphan Black.
Love the show
I wish that the language was not so fulgur in some areas, but I loved the rest of it. it was uplifting and gaaave me a chuckle.
Great series. Did not want it to end.
Love this season and this show...I wish there were more seasons
hilarious & fresh! great inside view of life on the other side of the pond~
Enjoyable English series ...
Funny show
Tidy!
Great show
Such a cute show! I've rewatched it a million times! Can't get enough!
Very funny,great characters!
It's a very funny show with lots of unexpected touches.
best Britcom EVER!!!
I love Gavin and Stacy. Too bad there are only 3 seasons.

Actually I would give this 10 stars if I could, I watched it twice and still thoroughly enjoyed it. My Grandfather was Welsh and my grandmother English and suppose being born and growing up in England helped me better understand the way of life. It's a pity that it was only 3 seasons and how lucky we are that no American version came out.
Enjoyable.

What's occurring?
Only the funniest, highly original, most heartfelt comedy in forever...!!
Too many quotable lines to list - I laughed 'till it hurt.
UK comedy at its best
Always makes me laugh!
This whole series is quirky and very sweet. I highly recommend it if you like British comedy.
I love this show!!!
Oh, Oh! That's cracking! What's occurring? I can't lie to ya, truth be told.
Great ending to a fantastic series. Terrific writing and very loveable characters with a very touching plot. Couldn't have asked for more from such a tidy finale.
Great. Very funny.
Season 3 is the final season. Like the other seasons, it is comic brilliance. I didn't want it to end, and no doubt, I'll be watching it again and again.
Really enjoyed all 3 seasons of this show and wish there were more!
Loved every season! Wish there was more.
Great show
quirky, funny.  Ruth Jones is great

We love this show. It's clever and well-written and every season is great. The US would probably never make a show this clever and original. The acting and writing is wonderful. Our only complaint is that we wish the show would've gone on and on.
I'm hooked on this show!  Russ Case, Largo, Fl USA
Love!
A great British sitcom. Well worth watching.
Absolutely loved it!  Light, zany, sweet, very english!
Lots of fun.

This is one of the most charming,witty,fun series I have seen . Loved it and have told so many people about it who have also loved it!! Just wish there were more seasons. How about a reunion show just so we can see how everyone is doing.

I love a good Brit show and this one is one of the best. I started watching this to become more familiar with James Corden as he's taking over for my beloved Craig Ferguson at the Late Late Show. I'd only ever known of James as Craig from Doctor Who. I was pleasantly surprised at the writing and the show as a whole. Not only is it hilarious, but it has a lot of warmth and it made me tear up a few times. Sweet. I only wish there'd been more than 3 seasons.
Loved it!
I LOVE this series!  It is so much better than 95% of American comedies......Characters are great and their interaction is hilarious...Five STARS for sure!!!
Was sad this was the last season but it did end well.  Special group of people that I looked forward to hearing a 'hiya'  and 'what's occuring' from. :)
Another season of a great show.  I would love to see some sort of wrap-up episode or two to catch up on the characters.
if you love Brit wit, this is a must watch

I loved this show as broadcasted! My hubby bought me seasons (series, as our cousins across the pond say) 1 and 3 on DVD a few years ago. I have watched this light but emotional show on Roku so I don't have to get up and down changing discs. I warn you that there are some silly moments cut recently, most noticeably where Smithy and his sister rap. Not vital to the story but I love to watch Gavin become annoyed or impatient. That's part of his character we need to see, as far as I am concerned.
  I love to watch these on a rainy day or when I need a good laugh. Like a conversation with an old friend, you can count on getting a few good laughs and a warm feeling from Gavin and Stacey. I subtracted a star because Nessa became more surly for no visible reason in season 3. And we never did find out about THE FISHING TRIP.
Very addictive! I watched all 3 seasons on the same day, which was a Sunday. Needless to save, I was VERY tired the next day. I was so bummed when I realize that there was no Season 4 :-(!!!
Lovable and crazy characters.  The entire series is a much watch!
Great final season for a wonderful show.  I just wish it hadn't been the final season.

I am very critical of any performance and I'm not too easy to please. Almost a year ago I said, "Enough of this garbage on American TV," and just got rid of it. Unbearable, low budget reality shows and my favorite stations are not what they once were. Cooking channels are about competition and celebrity, home improvement stations have changed to low-budget apartment and house hunting and history stations are now featuring Larry the Cable Guy. Enough!
 All that said, I finished the third season of "Gavin and Stacey" about a week ago and it feels like I just said goodbye to dear friends. I loved every single character on this show and the writing was clever and seldom predictable. How can you not fall in love with Nessa and hope that she and Smithy, an unlikely pair, end up together? Without giving anything away, as I approached the end of the final episode, I prayed that they didn't choose a happy Hollywood ending and I was not let down, yet I was supremely satisfied. Oh, I suppose there were times in which Stacey was so fervently going in one direction with her emotions (be it over acting, writing or directing) that you'd have to be pretty daft not to know what was going to happen next but it didn't matter. Her character was entertaining beyond any weakness in the storyline. And everyone should have a Gavin in their life. EVERYONE! I loved every single character whether I was supposed to or not. OMG, Pammy! Smithy's sister! The love/hate couple! Bryn! All of them!
 Obviously, I strongly recommend this feel-good sitcom. Try not to binge on this show. Spread it out over the course of a few weeks because, like an excellent novel, you are going to be sorry when it's over.
The funniest britcom I have ever watched.

Awesome show. Has you hooked from beginning to end. Can't believe it was written and produced by Smithy and Nessa, such talented writers, producers and actors. My favourite character has to be Gavin's Mum, "Pam". She cracks me up. Being Irish and British, I understand the lingo and miss it very much. All of the characters are unique and hilarious. It's so true to life and real that one can identify with the characters and families. Once you get a dose, you'll be screaming for more. Wish there were more episodes. Haven't laughed so much in a long time. A true classic !
Fast, funny with great characters!  An unexpectedly jewel.
Watched the whole series twice.  It's that funny!
Just a great series, and really funny in a real way not fake situations just great character driven comedy.
Very very subtle and funny - even if some of the references don't hit the American audience.
Drop off in funniness.  Stacey far too annoying in Season 3.
The actress playing Nessa was wonderful and for her I was whatching this series
Gavin and Stacy is a fun show, and Season 3 wrapped up many of the plot lines well.
Really enjoyed this show.  Has a tender side that  I feel is missing in American comedies.
More episodes, please.
Love this show!
An absolutely "Crackin" show! I love it!!!

Gavin and Stacy is a very funny show. It's a little difficult for Americans to understand some of the Welsh actors or get some of the jokes but still well worth watching as it's well acted and different from anything on US TV. Love British TV for this reason!

One of the best comedy/entertainment series I've seen in years.  The cast is just perfect - not just Gavin and Stacey but all the supporting characters and dead on perfect.  Ruth Jones as 'Nessa' and is the funniest character I've seen on TV since Absolutely Fabulous.

This is a quirky British comedy.  The main couple (Gavin and Stacy) ground the show, while the secondary characters (Smithy, Nessa, Bry and Pam) are quite funny.  If you like British comedy, you should like this one.
Light hearted fun.  Let's face it, you've known people like this, for better or worse.  But good for a grin.

Great show.  I thought all three seasons were fantastic.  You'll enjoy the gang from Essex and Barry.  All the characters have their own personalities and each one is a laugh riot.  I highly recommend this show.  Watch all 3 seasons.
it was funny well acted and addicting when it was over you feel like you have lost your friends
Witty Comedy from the BBC - Endearing characters
What a cute fun show, the characters are amazing, I only wished there were more seasons. We'll never know what really happened on "The Fishing Trip".
G r e a t  show ...if you ever sad ..watched it ....it will cheer you up is so funny sad witty
Awesomely written and presented.  This is so hilarious, I laughed until my sides hurt.  You have to love and appreciate the humor from a dry perspective.  I still cannot get enough.

great Show . very Funny Lo
Bet All The Character Hope To See More Seasons
The trouble with these Britcoms is they just don't make enough episodes to satisfy us Americans.  The characters are so engaging - my favorites are Bryn and Smitty.  Loved it!
Was looking forward to Season 4, too bad
I found this show by accident and I love it !! Wish they had more seasons,because I'm always going back to view the shows first and second season when I'm bored .
Excellent program.  A down to earth, believable light comedy about everyday life.  Excellent acting!  I really hated to see this season and the series end.

This is such a great show, all 3 seasons. Wonderful, funny characters that you feel you really know, storylines that are emotionally compelling but also comedic. A taste of Wales, England, omelets filled with feel-good warmth and humor. Also excellently acted! If you're not used to quick speech in Welsh and English accents you may need to turn on the subtitles.

I have laughed till my sides hurt. What a great show, thoroughly enjoyed this.
Thank you whoever wrote this. Absolutely brilliant.

This season made me sad, because I knew going in that it would be the last.  This never fails to bring me to happy tears and happy guffaws.  These characters are saved from being cartoonish by their heart---real, genuine heart at their base.  The humor is lovely and organic.  I felt bereft when it came to an end.
Another wonderful British comedy with funny characters...and some heart. I wish it went longer than 3 seasons. I'll miss Barry Island!

I love this show so much. The acting and writing are so, so great. I miss this story and these lovely, funny, very real characters. The last episode was so well done.  Everything's so relatable-sweet and touching and hilarious.
I am selfish, I want more- are you listening Ruth?

I really enjoyed all three seasons of this British series. The characters were interesting, funny, endearing and the story line is one that TV enthusiasts can identify with. Well worth the time of binge watching!
not great but a pleasant way to waste time. funny supporting cares and good writing make the show.  Lead actress is cute

The story is somewhat uneven over the seasons but the great acting put it over the top every time. This is a very talented production company with excellent casting. Some of the dialogue is lost to those of us in the US because many of the terms are local slang that is unfamiliar.
I thought, where can they go from here? The best season yet. And the ending, well I will not spoil but it was lush. Make's me want to go get a cheese and ham omelet and watch it all again.

This series is created by James Corden and Ruth Jones who pay the characters Smithy and Nessa respectively.  The show's supporting cast are as brilliant as the mains and I only wish they had gone past 3 seasons!
This show made me laugh, cry and fall in love with each character. Just awesome! Wish it never ended :0(
Great British comedy. So sad there were only 3 seasons! Holding out hope for a reunion... could it really happen?

Lots of fun characters in the show and for an American, it was an interesting look at a couple of different cultures (Wales and England).  I loved the different expressions (both Welsh and British) the people use.  I also love the very close-knit relationships portrayed in the story.  All around great show and I wish there were more.
One of the funniest shows from across the pond. Nessa and Smithy are absolutlely hilarious and one of the best couple/non couples on tv.

Gavin and Stacey is a sheer delight. The writing captures not just the culture of the characters, but the actors deliver the lines with an authenticity that informs the audience they know people just like those they portray. It is simply hilarious.
Hopefully they will do another season some day.
Really enjoyed the entire series and hated to see it end.  The show was fast moving, funny, and really drew you in.

The creators of Gavin and Stacey (Ruth Jones and James Corden) are the "best friends" in this series and they are hysterical.  The writing is great and the characters are all memorable (especially Uncle Bryn - Rob Brydon).  I was really sorry to see this show end and happy to find web rumors of a possible movie.  I would love more of this group of people and the wicked humor you have to love...
I thought this was a great show.  I laughed at every episode - many had me in tears. Very funny - I recommend checking it out

It's good to see that the Brits can produce a show that doesn't rely on painful cringe humor, which ultimately isn't funny.  This show and this season is equal parts hilarious and beautiful.  A great end to a wonderful show.

These short BBC seasons often leave me wanting more, but Gavin and Stacey Season 3 ends on a good note with optimistic outlooks for all the characters.  Family and friends continue to complicate the lives of the title couple in wacky and entertaining ways.  We get to know the friends better including Smithy and Vanessa who are made for each other but resist the connection.  Stacey's Uncle Bryn continues to amuse in his efforts to be one of the boys.  The last episode seemed to be incomplete as the advertised resolution of the fishing trip story didn't happen.

It could be because I lived there for more than a year.  Or it could be that its just funny. I have watched the whole series several times and it never fails to please.  I can always count on them for a giggle which is nice since I work in quite a difficult job.  I can come home and enjoy some quality time with the whole gang and forget about what happened during a 12 hour nursing shift.
Classic dry British humor at its best !!! I recommend anyone would love it. Not for the faint hearted, try it!!!
Loved every minute of this show.  Ruth Jones and James Corden are so much fun together. Alison Steadman and Rob Brydon are brilliant as well.

This show is one of the funniest British shows for years we have watched all 3 series several times always funny for sure

Great acting great characters watch it for sure
Delightfully entertaining, lots of laughing.  Love the British comedies Season 1 was great, Season 2 even better, and Season 3 a perfect wrap up

I used to live in England and had watched most of the seasons! I recently found it in America and had to watch it. I laughed from beginning to end......i only wish there was more seasons!!!! Would definitely recommend this!!!
So sad that this was the last season. Wish it would never end. Quirky, delightful characters and so engaging. OUr American writers need to take note!
Sorry to see it end, but I thought it was done well.  Great writing makes you love all the funny & quirky characters!
Simple, funny, rooty and authentic. Enjoy... A good show with amazing actors and simple story line beautifully woven. Gavin and Stacy.

I love the quirky characters in this show!
In all honesty, though, the show should be called Smithy and Nessa.

Great writing, great characters, great actors. The only thing wrong with Gavin and Stacey is that it ended too soon. Did the creative team run out of ideas? I doubt it. More like they just took the main story line - Nessa and Smithy's journey from mutual disdain to life partnership - full circle. Great twist. Most people seem to travel in the opposite direction.
I love that the people and situations are "real" and that, like most families and friends, they are accepting of each others' eccentricities.
It gets better and better.  Get to learn more Wenglish, like "tidy".  Ruth Jones is great.  Too bad it's over.
Loved all the seasons. Wish there were more to watch.  If you liked "Coupling" you'll love this one.  I love these BBC shows.
Thoroughly enjoyed all 3 seasons of Gavin & Stacey.  I only wish that there were more.  The characters were a great mix and the story lines were quite interesting/amusing.

I really loved watching this show. My family is very small (4) and not close. Shows like this let me feel like I'm part of a family, even if it is only make believe. All the characters are wonderful! I  wish there were more seasons for us. I've noticed with the good British show, they seem to only last for 3 years at the most. Plus, they only make 6 or 7 shows per season. NOT ENOUGH!! We need more! The t.v. here in America is HORRIBLE! And keeps getting worse. Ugh!!! I need to move to England! Wish I could!
Watch this show. You'll LOVE it!
I loved this season! The opener was great and it ended on a fun note also. All the characters in it were in their prime!

Two disparate families, one Welsh and one from working class England, are united by the romance and marriage of their children.  The two families have their strengths and weaknesses as all real people do.  Each episode has real world issues and happily resolves them (maybe not realistically).  It never takes it to the preachy level and keeps it light, funny and entertaining.
Funny story, fabulous characters and character development, and just great British TV. The writing is excellent. Made me want to go to Wales .

I love shows that deal with profound issues through humor. I also connect with the wit of the Brits. I am about 80%Welsh and 20% English, and I often wonder what my life would have been if my grandmother hadn't come to America in 1920. All of the characters are right out of my own family!
This entire show is awesome! I highly recommend it.  If you like Brit-Coms....this one is funny and charming. Wonderful show

This series is funny and well done.  Every character is well developed and engaging.  Ness is a blast and Smithy is a hoot, but oh yes, then there is Bryn, he's hysterically funny as well...how to pick?  So many great comedians all together for one show...wish it was still going!
The writing is brilliant. The characters are fun and lovable. And the cultural differences between the English characters and the Welsh characters are amazingly hilarious.
What a delightful ensemble!  I loved that the actors were actually english and welsh. Of course, I did need to use captioning!

I watched season one on netflix but they didn't have season 2 or 3?  What is up with that.  Anyway this show is knee slapping hi-lar-ious!  Don't miss it.  Nessa will floor you. Gavin and Stacy are so cute. The rest of the crew is adorable too.  This show is just too funny to miss.  I only wish that there were more episodes.  It has won many awards and was critically acclaimed in Britain.  Just watch it. you will not be sorry.  ps not for kids.
Absolutely hooked and can't get enough of this series. I love the cast especially smithy and nessa!! Wish I had found it sooner but so glad I did find this treasure!!! Much love
So cute, funny and clever.  Loved it.  I'm sad it's only three seasons.  I wish there were more!!  Please make more like this.
I enjoy the writing and acting. The ending is perfect. It was not what I thought would happen in a million years but truely perfect.

...but it's worth it.  What a hilarious crew of characters!  I really love this show.  And there's the benefit of learning so much  British slang.  The episodes are "crackin'" and "tidy" and "brilliant."
love this show, I wish they made more seasons! The characters are brilliant and the writing is terrific. Honestly submit already.

I thought this season was okay. It was still a cute romantic comedy/dramedy type of show. The problems that Gavin and Stacey faced were realistic. Although,they were handled in a ridiculous manner in some instances,it did not take anything away from the show. The last episode was a bit too predictable,but it tied in with the premise of the show and wasn't disappointing. I rated it a bit down for predictability,but then again,it is a comedy and we'll worth watching.
One of the funniest series ever...don't miss it! I keep coming back to it so I can enjoy the great one-liners & Welsh expressions.
My husband and I like this show. It is cute and the characters are funny. It is a little racy like most British comedies, but not too bad. Give it a watch if you like "How I met your Mother."
Love this show! A cute and quirky British comedy. If you like BBC television this is a great little romcom!!!
The Christmas family gathering was like real family gatherings not the fake Hollywood family Christmases. The show has a feel good and cheery spirit that always left me with a good feeling.

The cast is really talented. The characters are great. Wonderfully hilarious and entertaining.
Smithy and Nessa are terrific as Gavin and Stacy's best
friends. I wish there was more to watch.

This is a great show and i enjoyed it completely. I love the accents. Its fun, but best for adults.
Its great too see some fun actors , all are very talented and refreshing.
I love the characters in this show. After watching the series, you feel like you know them. The dialogue is brilliant.
I liked the show, I saw all three seasons and loved it. I would highly recommend it to anyone who likes BBC shows
This was the absolute best season. I will be sad to not follow the story since there isn't a season four...
So funny. Great lighthearted Saturday afternoon show. I wish they would continue the story. I want more! We had a great time watching
season three was exciting and it tied up loose ends.the last two episodes were absolutely hilarious and very touching. loved it

very enjoyable series watched all episodes strait through
would recommend it highly for those who like British comedy
well worth the time
If you're new to the series, this might be confusing, but for the rest of us, it's a seasonal blast of great writing, great performances.
This show hits all the right notes.  Each character is unique, eccentric yet lovable.  The humor is quirky and we particularly like trying to acquaint our ear with the Welsh accent.
I love this series and I sincerely hope they make one more episode with Stacey giving birth to the baby.

I recently watched all three seasons and am disappointed there won't be a forth. At first, I was lukewarm about the series but it kept building into a better and better program. By the third season, it had all come together and was absolutely hilarious.

I will miss these folks on the show....great series with a great acting ensemble.  Highly recommended.

Hilarious and and an emotional roller coaster ride, this show pushes the limits and always takes on step over the line.  It's set in Wales and England, where Stacey and Gavin are from, respectively - and is about their relationship and the intertwining of the lives of their friends and families.  Character development is brilliant and while the story line is also quite good, I think the characters were even more so. Raunchy humor at times, mixed with just enough sweetness to be one of the more endearing shows I've seen in a long while.  I was thoroughly entertained and didn't want it to end.  A wonderful collaboration by Jones and Corden and spectacular performances by the entire cast.
I very much enjoy this series, it was fun and very credible. It's such a pity that just 3 seasons were released.
I loved this show when it was originally aired. I love it today even more though. Simply Delightful. a must see, all 3 seasons.
Great show, fun to watch. Too bad only 3 seasons. Wish there were three more to watch. Highly recommend this show.

The story line has developed nicely since the scene was set in season 1.  The romance between Gavin (from London, England) and Stacy (from Barry, Wales) has blossomed into marriage.  All the characters have been fleshed out fully.  Each role has been well cast.  Much of the humor plays off the idiosyncrasies of being English versus Welsh.  It's all done in good fun and it's great entertainment.
Oh! What's occurring?! Hilarity . Simple as. I'd say more but no need. Watched it twice and it was even funnier the second time. I only wish there was a fourth season.
One of the best British TV shows of all time, only 3 seasons but like the Office too little is very much more!
Excellent cast, clever and VERY funny writing.  My favorite comedy of all time.  It's a shame they only made 3 seasons.
This was a great show, the characters were fun, the story line kept me intrigued and wanting to follow along with each episode... Loved it!

Tidy! Wouldn't be Christmas without the Gavin & Stacey Christmas Special!

From the Christmas Turkey to Smithy's Christmas shopping. Classic.
I loved this when it was first shown on BBC America. It is funny, very entertaining. I only wish there had been a fourth season to complete the story line. But I highly recommend.

One of the funniest comedy series on TV.  Great ensemble cast.  Every episode is extremely entertaining,  I absolutely love this series and I highly recommend it.  Gavin and Stacy is 5 STAR entertainment.
One of the best made series I have ever seen, love the English humor, would love to have seen more of this series.
I enjoyed these characters very much, and loved to hear the Welsh sayings and accent.  Uncle Bryn was my favorite character.
Just a great well written and acted series. Uncle Bryn and Pamelaaah are the stars of the show - well done team!
Another stellar season of one of my favorite shows.  Full of funny drama and some great story arches. Also Neil the baby is adorable!
This is such a great series.  The characters are outrageous and the situations are unique.  Want to see more of this show.
Very funny and entertaining while at the same time keep a realness to the writing as I've never seen before in a sitcom.
Superb writing, hilarious characters - its funny because its British deadpan irony at its best. One to watch whenever you want cheering gup
I would so love to see this show back on the air. Great cast and characters. I would definitely recommend.

Like all the rest of the series, this was a great episode as well.  And what's even better is that it's twice as long at an hour long!  It captures the spirit of Christmas, while still maintaining the overall comedic integrity of the show.  A must see for fans of "Gavin and Stacey"!

This is a conditional review, in that, if you're watching season 3, then you've already seen seasons 1 and 2. That said, you'd be quite happy with the way things shape up in the third season. "I won't lie to you," Nessa is still hilarious. Smithy's robot dance is still funny as ever, and dare I say that Stacey is even a little bolder than she once was.

The only downside to Season 3 is that there's no Season 4 to move on to. Sad, sad, indeed.

A fun, cheeky, easy-to-watch series that will be sure to keep you laughing.  I'm not going to lie to you, at the end of the day, you'll wish there was more!  The only thing we didn't like about this series was that we enjoyed it so much, we burned through all the episodes too quickly!  A real shame.
An absolute gem of  series.  Great writing ... fantastic characters ... absolutely brilliant!  it would be great if there were at least 25-50 more episodes.

I started out not liking this crowd as distasteful, sophomoric, but they grew on me. Maybe I like distasteful, sophomoric as a change of pace from boring tasteful(not) American sitcoms. The Welsh mentality is a banal touch. Try this series.
All the characters play their roles wonderfully and the humor is awesome.  Even Americans can relate.  great for weeknight or weekend fun.
Even better than Seasons 1 and 2.  Great character development and poignant yet hilarious dialogue.  Wish there were more seasons to watch.

I just love this show ! The writers did such a great job creating real characters. Yes, they are flawed. And yes, you come to admire them. I would love to see more of all of them, but it is  so refreshing to see a story arc that ends properly ( and isn't drawn out for years as is done in American television). At the end of the day- this is just a great series!

When I try to describe this show to friends, the word "charming" inevitably finds its way into the description.  The writing by cast members Ruth Jones and James Corden is superb and the characters are relatable and the whole clan is, well, charming.  Do yourself a favor and have a Gavin and Stacey marathon soon.
Once again, I'm jealous of the UK and their great programming! This is a well written series, with a great cast to back it up. I'm sad to see it end.

The final season (YES...ONLY 3!!! WAKE UP BBC!) is fantastic. While we never actually find out what happened on the now infamous fishing trip, we still feel like we are in a good place with all concerned. If this show does get legs in its American version, I do hope Ruth Jones takes a very active hand and perhaps allows us to learn more about Nessa. She is the lynch pin of the show. You never know what will come out of her mouth and G & S fans were treated to some cameos that perhaps American viewers might not have picked up on. Again, it will be fun to see how it pulls off in the States if it ever gets off the ground.
This is quality TV. Great characters, great writing.  It's Judt brutal that it ends with so few episodes, leaving you wanting much more.

I happened upon this UK series completely by accident - and after the first few minutes I knew I was hooked.
For American audiences, there aren't may portions of the show which require any kind of subtitles, even the local Welch lingo is easily understood.

I found myself literally laughing out loud. Not a giggle, not a smile...but out loud laughing. This is a romantic comedy which is enhanced by extended family, extended friends and leads you to become more and more entwined in the lives surrounding "Gavin and Stacey".

Gavin plays well off of his 'mate' Smiffy, who plays off of Gavin's Mom and Dad, who play off of their odd matched neighbors - then there is Stacey, her Mom and Uncle ( my personal favorite) and how they play off of Stacey's best 'mate' 'Nessa -- and the rest unfolds before your eyes episode by episode.

Light, funny and translatable - definitely recommended.
Very cute show.  Love the characters!!!!! I liked it a lot and wish there were more shows like it.  I don't like that there are a required set number of words I have to write for this rating.
really, do you need a review of this? It is great, the characters are believable, funny, and sometimes over the top. just watch it.
THIS IS THE BEST SHOW, WAS HAPPY TO FIND IT ON AMAZON. I REALLY ENJOY BRITISH TELE. VERY FUNNY SHOW. BRITISH TELE ROCKS MY SOCK
Watched Gavin and Stacy on the advice of a coworker...laughed until I cried. Great characters!! The only way it could be better is to know there were more seasons coming. :(

I love Gavin & Stacey. So much.
I watch it very often, sometimes even just in the background.
I also love Amazon Prime. In fact, one of the main reasons I have a Prime membership is so I can put G&S on whenever I want. (The complete, unedited G&S.)

HOWEVER...sometime in the last few weeks the streaming version was edited to exclude at least one musical number in Season 3 (the Smithy/Smithy Kanye rap). Likely the musical parts in the other seasons are now edited out. It's really too bad b/c the U.S. DVDs aren't complete either. The only possible way for Americans to see the complete G&S now is to get a blu-ray player and then get the region free blu-ray version from amazon.co.uk--but actually i'm not even sure THAT version is complete.

As Lady Catherine would say: "I'm quite put out!"

I've sent feedback about this to Amazon Prime but I doubt they can do anything to get the content back. I thought I'd let you guys know that you are missing out on key scenes of "comedy gold." (You might be able to find them on youtube still, but sheesh how annoying.)

Gavin & Stacy is The Best!  Great characters and very funny!  I would highly recommend this show to everyone.  I only wish there as Season 4 and beyond to continue the story of Gavin & Stacy, their family and friends.  The Bottom-line:  Gavin & Stacy is Cracking, Tidy, Smashing, and Lush!  Watch the show and you will get my meaning.  Enjoy!  Cheers!

At the end of the day, it's tidy. You gorra watch it, orrigh?
It's a fabulous show, very real humour from both Wales and England - as a Welsh person myself I can totally relate.

No matter how many times I watch this show it never gets old.. I love the characters the story..Everything..This show grows on you and keeps you wanting more..Hopefully someday they will do a reunion special.. I know there is an American version coming soon but it will never replace the original..
Interesting characters, it was fun to watch, funny in a sense that it wasn't raunchy, I really enjoyed it, every season was good.
Need more episodes please.  This was a great show.  Too bad the writers felt we had enough!  The show was hilarious.
This is classic British comedy. The only problem with it is that there are only three seasons and the viewers are left wanting even more.
excellent cast, writing and performances.  Love everything about this series. Wish it could still go on.  Will miss everyone involved.

I absolutely adored the 3 seasons of Gavin & Stacey (from across the pond).
I watched the episodes over the course of 3 evenings and thoroughly enjoyed each one.
I laughed, cried and wanted more. I still do.
Wish this show continued but I am satisfied with how it ended.
I understand an American version is coming this Fall but it won't beat the original UK version.
Would highly recommend!!

Gavin & Stacey is so amazing! I can watch it and rewatch it so many times. It's one of those shows that pulls you in and makes you feel like part of the family. The humor is spot on... I'm not British or Welsh. You really don't have to be from the UK to think it's funny. There are some references I definitely don't get-- but it's also really interesting learning about the differences between Essex and Wales. IT COULDN'T TAKE PLACE ANYWHERE ELSE! It's relevant but I just think this show is so perfect as is. (Why do we Americans have to remake everything??)

The show is a great combination of funny, romantic, and sweet. There's something really true and sentimental to it-- in a good way! Plus it has moments that feel so real and true to life, and others that are more absurd-- it has a wide range. I think it also appeals to a wide audience. I love the way the kids party with their parents. It really shows the way families and circles are built. It's a wonderful coming together story that shows it isn't always easy bringing different people together.

Pam is hilarious... and eventually the story really becomes- Nessa & Smithy-- which is brilliant. Nessa is amazing! Amazing catch phrases. I love love love this show. I'm so glad I watched it. There's something so unique and lovely about Gavin & Stacey. After watching it, I just feel like it stays with me. A little piece of it has attached itself and when I watch I can't help wishing I could spend christmas with the family or go to Capriccios! Best show I have watched all year. Alexis Bledel as Stacey... NO. I'd love to see THIS Gavin & Stacey come back. That would be crackin'!

Tidy.

Love this show.
Need more like it. Like " the i.t. crowd"  or "ideal".
Also, when am I going to be able to watch amazon movies on my phone?
This cleverly written comedy is wildly entertaining, English humour at it's finest. I would recommend this to everyone who enjoys a good laugh

Well written show about the love between a British guy from Essex and a Welsh girl from Barry.
Characters are well developed, and you care about what happens to one and all.
This is one of my all time favorite shows. It is charming, and is made up of real-life characters that you can imagine spending time with.
Very well written and love the actors. I really wish it would have been continued for a couple of seasons.
This show is truly funny. I enjoyed it and hope a new season is created. All of the characters are likeable and the storyline is really cute.

The Gavin and Stacey series made me laugh, giggle and cry. I loved it, a comedy from across the pond that entertained the stages, awkward moments, pinnacle and poignant emotions of a relationship. The acting troop was full of character variety, whilst Gavin and Stacey were the focal point, the supporting characters added to the series story line, branching out with real-life character flaws that you would recognize in your own life circle of friends and family. Gavin and Stacey is a fresh approach to a love story. I applaud the producers for not creating another sci-fi, stuffy aristrocratic drama, police or murder mystery program. A sweet story-line that redeemed British television (for me) and is a reminder of the tribulations both positive and negative in a relationship.
I am in love with this series. It is one of the few shows I can watch over and over and never get tired of it!
You could not ask for a better comedy series than this. We loved everyone of the characters and thoroughly enjoyed their hilarious interaction!!

If you enjoy the BBC comedy television shows, then you will probably like this one.  It is pure fluff and just fun to watch.  Some of the characters are a bit annoying at first, but they grow on you in time.  Ruth Jones did a great job of portraying "Vanessa" in this series. While I am sorry to see it end, the writers did a great job of ending the Series.  The story lines were all wrapped up in an easy to follow manner.

Ruth Jones is my new favorite ever. Of anything. (Except Doctor Who)
Rob Brydon's Bryn is one of the best characters to grace the tv screen.
Alison Steadman.
All of them, they're all so wonderful to watch.
Do yourself a favor and see it here, before the American version destoys it.  Just like they did with Coupling...

This season was just as good as 1 and 2. I love the cast and characters. Just saw they have made an American version, not looking forward to it. No one can play Smithy, Nessa, Gwen, it will never be as good! It always made me happy when I watched!
British comedy at its best, its fun is from start to finsh you will not see better TV highly recommended

I found refreshing the NORMALITY of this series. Most of all how differences between people are treated with truthful and again normal attitudes. And there is the real life humor and comedy, conflict and misunderstandings, a broad spectrum of personalities and uninhibited but not exaggerated interactions. Then each personality is reach in its own distinct way, making watching this first caliber actors play a real treat. There is no violence, war, crime, dirty language, contortions of the mind, gratuitous or illogical narrative, time fillers or stale recipes.
Who I think would enjoy this series? Open minded people with a taste for life the way it is rather than contorted maid up case studies. People that understand having a life, not just coloring a survival routine.
Very funny and entertaining. Enjoyed the family dynamics and the characters were hilarious. Highly recommend seasons 1 through 3.  Easy watching and characters are relatable
My daughter and I love everything about this show. It is hilarious and has a very authentic quality. We love Smithy, Nessa, and Uncle Bryn. Watch this show!!!

I first started watching Gavin and Stacey on BBCAmerica, and fell in love with it. I have watched all the seasons for it, and continue to come to watch. I love the way the show is shaped, and the characters. All of the actor are spot on. I wouldn't mind seeing another season to see what happened with them. I really should just buy the DVD's for home.
I love this series.  I enjoy the lively characters and the slang in the dialog.  Trying to figure out what they are saying is part of the fun.
This was one show I was happy to have stumbled upon!  Love the whole gang!  It never fails to make me laugh.

This season is more fun, and its great to see the families get together and accept each other.  Vanessa is a little hard to take (very, very selfish) but she is what she is, and she's right out there with it.  That's great.
True to the British form-short and sweet.  I would love to have more, but better that all of it was so good!

Smart, humane, funny, well written. Smithy (Corbin) and Nessa (Jones) are priceless, but characters like Rob Bryden's OCD neighbor, the unashamedly lascivious grandma next door and  Gavin's amiable but bovine mates are a delight. There is an overall frank unsentimental sweetness to the story which is a rare pleasure. Reminded me of Mike Leigh's best work.

Hilarious, fresh and surprisingly heart warming.
Keeping my fingers crossed for season 4!
Defiantly the best comedy I have seen in a long time.

Season 3, the last season of Gavin and Stacey, is the unfortunate end of a great situation comedy.  Not since the best addictive television comedies like Seinfeld and Cheers before it, has there been such a show worthy of a dedicated following--and sadly America doesn't even know about it. I just happened upon Gavin and Stacey and after a couple shows, I watched 3 seasons of it in 3 days. The best aspect of this show is that there are truly talented actors who wholly inhabit their characters.  The most annoying, off-putting, characteristic of any show for me, particularly a comedy, is when an actor is constantly aware of what he's doing--the audience is watching him act.  His/her, ego is on full display completely thrilled at this opportunity to strut his stuff in a show.  That doesn't happen in Gavin and Stacey.  Some of these characters are over the top, and you believe them, even love them for their idiosyncrasies.  Gavin and Stacey are two very nice people, who you might know.  They are genuine and sweet and innocently funny.  But the characters that surround them--their families and friends--are straight-up crazy, funny, flawed, sweet, loving, honest people--just like your aunts, uncles and friends.  Pam, Gavin's mom, so mom-ish--loving her prince of a son, sexy with her husband, sometimes trying to be who she isn't, giving and selfish, fussy and warm--is simply funny.  Smithy, Gavin's best friend, is somewhat rotund, cutting back on his eating with a 6-pack of chicken, corn on the cob and other sides, at the end of a night of partying; always greets Gavin with a shared hip-hop song and choreography--with Gav's mom and dad joining in when they're around--quite capably, I might add; rolling on the floor in a tussle with his younger sister--another hip-hop master; and, an all-round hysterically funny good guy!  Brin, Stacey's uncle is embodied by Rob Brydon, of The Trip...OMG, I adore him... Brin lingers just a minute too long when he hugs Gav, and he is harboring some secret experience...that happened on a fishing trip with his nephew, Stacey's brother...it was very cold on that trip... And, last but certainly not least, Nessa, Stacey's best friend.  Nessa is a hearty (like Smithy) Welsh lady, who is completely blunt in her honest, slightly stilted, take on the world.  She can assist her bouncer friends at the local night club, and go head-to-head with Smithy on a KFC mega meal, where a butter-dripping ear of corn becomes an unexpected bit of foreplay.  The only thing that an American audience might take a bit of getting used to are the British and Welsh accents...but please, give it a minute...the Welsh accents become another great joke.  This only negative about this comedy is that there are not 5 more seasons to hang out with these people.  This is a great, funny and very warm ensemble show.

Good cast of quirky characters, which are still identifiable.  There is a bit of each of us in these characters.  Contagious! Some American to Brit translation needed, but is very accessible to just about anyone.
it is a simple comdey that you will enjoy. i need to put down 11 more words so enjoy enjoy

Wanting more from last season, there were pulls on heart strings as Cavin and Stacy work out the difficulty of living with his parents, then moving to where Stacy's family is from. Nessa and her baby's father pull them even harder while the grins and laughs of life make this an amazing but not stupid sit com.
Ruth Jones and James Corden are a laugh riot. Great show. I wish American sitcoms were this well written and acted.
I love this show and really wish they would write another season of it.  I miss the characters.  Great streaming quality on amazon.
Another fantastic series, I can watch it over and over again and still enjoy it each time! A classic :)
Should really be 4 stars because we're left with one question...what exactly happened on that fishing trip?
Love this show! Funny and witty! Highly recommend!
Love this show!
Loved it
An amazing episode and fun review of family interactions.
This is a great show.  Ruth Jones is the best.  The writing is wonderful with the references.
One of the best shows ever made!
Hilarious, odd, touching.  James Cordon and Ruth Jones are genius!
After watching a few episodes of season one the first day, we bought seasons 2&3. These are very entertaining. Great characters,situations, and British humor.
LOVE THIS SHOW!  I watch the entire series at least once a year.  Hilarious and heartwarming.
